New Records: The Cavaliers became the 4th NBA team to start a season at 15-0, matching the second-best start in NBA history.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points and 12 assists.
Ty Jerome matched his career-high in both points (24) and assists (8).
Evan Mobley added a double-double with 23 points and 11 rebounds.
Jarrett Allen added a double-double with 21 points and 15 rebounds.
LaMelo Ball scored a game-high 31 points and 12 assists.
Cleveland outscored Charlotte 26-15 in the final quarter to seal the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs are just the fourth team to open a season 15-0, matching the second-best start in NBA history.
All three previous teams to start 15-0 made the Finals that season, with the 1993-94 Houston Rockets winning the championship.
